meanings.definition: Of or relating to the interaction of electric currents or fields and magnetic fields.
meanings.sent1: The electrodynamic forces between the magnets were fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the electrodynamic properties of the new material.
meanings.sent3: The electrodynamic dance of the electrons around the nucleus was like a tiny ballet.
meanings.sent4: The storm's power was as electrodynamic as a lightning strike.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration made the concept of electrodynamic interactions clear.

meanings.definition: A branch of physics that deals with the interactions between electricity and magnetism.
meanings.sent1: The student was eager to learn more about electrodynamic in physics class.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained the principles of electrodynamic to the curious students.
meanings.sent3: The party conversation somehow turned into a discussion about electrodynamic - it was unexpected!
meanings.sent4: The city's growth was an electrodynamic process, influenced by various factors.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased the history of electrodynamic research in an engaging way.
